intro: Colignonia biumbellata, commonly known as the two-armed colignonia, is a rare flowering plant native to the cloud forests of South America. It is characterized by its unique inflorescence, which consists of two branching clusters of small, white flowers. The plant produces fragrant blooms that attract specific pollinators, such as certain species of bees and butterflies. Its leaves are typically lance-shaped and have a waxy texture, adapted to the humid and shaded conditions of its natural habitat. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Colignonia biumbellata is considered a vulnerable species.
